title: Oscar Winner Diane Keaton Dies at 79
snippets: Diane Keaton, who remained one of Hollywood's quirkiest and most beloved actors decades after her Academy Award-winning performance in the movie Annie Hall , has died aged 79.
She was best known for roles in films including in The Father of the Bride, The Godfather and Annie Hall.
Keaton was best known for her roles in Annie Hall, Reds and The Godfather films.
Diane Keaton's first big break was in the 1970s in "The Godfather" series. She also won an Oscar in 1978 for "Annie Hall."
Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning actress known for her performances in "Annie Hall" and "The Godfather," has died at the age of 79.

The legendary actor best known for her many collaborations with Woody Allen, as well as films including Reds, The First Wives Club and Book Club, has died Diane Keaton: a life in pictures Peter Bradshaw on Diane Keaton Keaton interviewed in 2023 and 2014 Jess Cartner-Morley on Keaton’s style Diane K
Diane Keaton, who rose to fame in "The Godfather" trilogy and "Annie Hall," died on October 11. She was 79.

Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning star of “Annie Hall,” “The Godfather” films and “Father of the Bride,” whose quirky, vibrant manner and depth made her one of the most singular actors of a generation, has died. She was 79. People Magazine reported Saturday that she died in California with loved ones,
titles: Hollywood's quirky leading lady, Diane Keaton, dies aged 79
Academy Award-winning actress Diane Keaton dies aged 79
Oscar-winning actress Diane Keaton dies aged 79

summary: Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning actress renowned for her roles in "Annie Hall" and "The Godfather," has died at the age of 79 in California. Her career, spanning over five decades, made her a beloved figure in Hollywood. The news was confirmed by People magazine.

title: China Urges Diplomatic Talks, Warns of Countermeasures to Trump's Tariff Threat
snippets: China signaled Sunday that it would not back down in the face of a 100% tariff threat from President Donald Trump, urging the U.S. to resolve differences through negotiations instead of threats.
Beijing says it could introduce "countermeasures" if the US President imposes an an additional 100% tariff on Chinese imports.
Beijing says it will not back down in the face of threats, urging the US to resolve differences through negotiations.

BEIJING (AP) — China signaled Sunday that it would not back down in the face of a 100% tariff threat from President Donald Trump, urging the U.S. to resolve differences through negotiations instead of threats. “China’s stance is consistent,” the Commerce Ministry said in a statement posted online. “
titles: China vows to stand firm against Trump's 100% tariff threat
China accuses US of 'double standards' over tariff threat
China slams Trump’s 100 percent tariff threat, defends rare earth curbs
China vows to stand firm against Trump’s 100% tariff threat
summary: China has responded to President Trump's threat of imposing a 100% tariff on Chinese imports by urging the U.S. to seek resolution through negotiation, not threats. Beijing has warned it will introduce "countermeasures" if such tariffs are implemented. The Commerce Ministry emphasized China's consistent stance on seeking diplomatic solutions over conflict.

title: Spratly Collision Escalates China-Philippines Tensions
snippets: But China's coastguard says Manila is to blame for the latest collision in disputed waters in the Spratly archipelago.
Manila has decried the incident as a "clear threat" from China, while Beijing insists the Philippines' vessels bear "full responsibility" for the collision in the long-disputed naval region.

Beijing blames Manila for the collision, saying the ship ‘ignored repeated stern warnings from the Chinese side’ A Chinese ship “deliberately rammed” a Philippine government vessel anchored near an island in a disputed part of the South China Sea, Manila’s coast guard said on Sunday. Confrontations
Philippines Says Chinese Ship Rammed Government Vessel at Sea Bloomberg.com
titles: Philippines accuses China of ramming, damaging vessel in South China Sea
Philippines says China rammed their ship in South China Sea
Philippines says Chinese ship ‘deliberately rammed’ government boat in South China Sea
Philippines Says Chinese Ship Rammed Government Vessel at Sea - Bloomberg.com
summary: A collision in the disputed Spratly archipelago has escalated tensions between China and the Philippines. Beijing claims Manila's vessel bore "full responsibility," citing "ignored warnings," while Manila accuses a Chinese ship of deliberately ramming its government vessel, calling it a "clear threat." Both nations hold opposing views on the incident in the contested South China Sea region.

title: Tiger Woods Successfully Undergoes Seventh Back Surgery
snippets: Tiger Woods underwent lumbar disk replacement surgery Friday, he announced on social media Saturday.

Woods has lumbar disc replaced in New York 15-time major winner calls operation successful No timetable set for 49-year-old’s golf return Tiger Woods has announced that he underwent back surgery on Friday to address a collapsed disc in his spine. The 15-time major winner had lumbar disk replacement
Tiger Woods has gone through a seventh back surgery, this time to replace a disk in his lower back and had caused pain and mobility issues.
titles: Tiger endures seventh back surgery in 11 years
Tiger Woods comeback in doubt after seventh back surgery for collapsed disc
Tiger Woods has seventh back surgery to have disk replaced
summary: Tiger Woods underwent his seventh back surgery, replacing a lumbar disk to address pain and mobility issues. The 15-time major winner confirmed the operation in New York was successful but has not set a timeline for his return to golf. This marks the second back surgery for the 49-year-old in just over a year.

title: Global Leaders, Including Trump, to Attend Gaza Peace Summit in Egypt
snippets: Leaders from more than 20 countries to attend meeting in Egypt's Sharm el-Sheikh, Egyptian presidency says.
The Egyptian presidency said the meeting is part of "Trump’s vision to achieve peace in the region."
Monday meeting comes as Hamas is due to free Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners

More than 500,000 Palestinians return to destruction in Gaza City as 20 world leaders, including Trump, prepare for talks. This blog is now closed. Malak A Tantesh , a young reporter who has contributed to the Guardian’s coverage, has written about a harrowing two years in besieged Gaza . You can re

summary: Leaders from over 20 countries, including the UK, Italy, Spain, France, and the US, represented by Donald Trump, will attend a Gaza peace summit in Sharm el-Sheikh, Egypt, chaired by Trump and Egyptian President Abdel Fatah al-Sisi. This meeting occurs as more than 500,000 Palestinians return to Gaza City's destruction.

title: 18 Presumed Dead After Explosion at Tennessee Munitions Factory
snippets: A blast in rural Tennessee that leveled an explosives plant and was felt for miles around killed 16 people and left no survivors, authorities said.
Officials say victims' families have been notified and that the cause of the blast is still not known.
Authorities say that 16 people were killed in the munitions plant explosion, down from the number of 18 initially thought to have been killed.
titles: 16 people died in a blast at a Tennessee explosives factory early Friday, sheriff says
At least 16 killed in blast at Tennessee explosives plant
'No survivors' found after Tennessee plant blast
summary: Following an explosion at Accurate Energetic Systems, a munitions factory in Tennessee, 18 individuals initially reported missing are now presumed dead, according to officials. The operation has shifted from rescue to recovery, with no survivors expected. The factory, located near McEwen, specializes in explosives for various industries. The incident occurred on Friday, with officials confirming the transition to recovery efforts on Saturday.

title: Madagascar Troops Back Protests Against President, Challenge Leadership
snippets: Elite troops join youth-led protests over utilities that have swelled into gravest threat for President Andry Rajoelina.

After an elite CAPSAT unit sided with protesters in Madagascar's capital, the soldiers claimed to control the entire military. President Andry Rajoelina said an "attempt to seize power illegally" was underway.
The unit appealed to security forces in this southern African nation to disobey their superiors and to refuse to shoot at demonstrators, who have rallied in the streets for more than two weeks.
titles: Madagascar army unit claims control as president alleges power-grab
Madagascar: Elite army unit turns on President Rajoelina
Fears of a Coup Rise in Madagascar as Army Unit Joins Protesters
summary: In Madagascar, elite CAPSAT troops have joined youth-led protests against utility issues, posing a significant challenge to President Andry Rajoelina. The soldiers claim to control the military and have urged security forces to support the demonstrators and not to follow orders to shoot at them. Rajoelina has described the situation as an illegal power grab. The protests have been ongoing for over two weeks.

title: Scheifele Leads Jets to First Season Win with 3-2 Victory Over Kings
snippets: Mark Scheifele tied the game late in the second and scored the winner midway through the third as the Jets picked up their first win of the season.
Scheifele scores twice, Jets defeat Kings for 1st win NHL.com
Mark Scheifele scored his second goal of the game midway through the third period to give the Winnipeg Jets a hard-fought 3-2 victory over the Los Angeles Kings on Saturday afternoon.
titles: Scheifele scores twice as Winnipeg Jets outlast Kings 3-2 for first win of season
Scheifele scores twice, Jets defeat Kings for 1st win - NHL.com
Mark Scheifele scores tying, winning goals as Jets top Kings
summary: Mark Scheifele scored twice, including the winning goal in the third period, leading the Winnipeg Jets to a 3-2 victory over the Los Angeles Kings. This win marks the Jets' first of the season.

summary: Intense clashes erupted along the Pakistan-Afghanistan border after the Taliban attacked Pakistani military posts, in retaliation for a Pakistani airstrike in Kabul. The conflict marks a significant escalation in tensions between Pakistan and the Taliban-controlled Afghanistan.

title: Mexico Floods and Landslides Kill 41; Troops Deployed for Relief
snippets: Authorities said the death toll had risen to at least 41 amid severe flooding and landslides in the south east. Thousands of troops have been deployed to help with disaster efforts.
The downpours also damaged thousands of homes and cut off power to entire towns. More rain was expected this weekend.
Floods caused by torrential rains have killed at least 41 people in Mexico in recent days and left behind a trail of destruction, the government said Saturday.
titles: Mexico: Floods and landslides claim dozens of lives
Heavy Rain, Floods and Landslides in Mexico Kill at Least 41
At least 41 dead in Mexico floods
summary: Severe flooding and landslides in southeast Mexico have resulted in at least 41 deaths, with thousands of troops deployed for disaster relief. The heavy rains damaged homes and disrupted power, with more rain forecasted.

title: Trump Ensures Military Pay Amid US Government Shutdown Standoff
snippets: Trump demands Defense secretary "get our Troops PAID" amid government shutdown Axios

President claims he found a way to pay troops and directed Pentagon chief to release funds on 15 October Donald Trump claimed on Saturday that he had found a way to pay US military troops despite the ongoing federal government shutdown, saying he had instructed his defence secretary, Pete Hegseth ,

Donald Trump says he has directed the defence secretary to release funds on 15 October. Key US politics stories from 11 October at a glance Donald Trump claimed he had found a way to pay US military troops despite the federal government shutdown, saying he had instructed his defence secretary, Pete
Trump Says US Troops Will Be Paid on Oct. 15 Despite Shutdown Bloomberg.com
titles: Trump demands Defense secretary "get our Troops PAID" amid government shutdown - Axios
Trump says military members will be paid despite government shutdown
Trump news at a glance: US troops will be paid despite shutdown, president claims
Trump Says US Troops Will Be Paid on Oct. 15 Despite Shutdown - Bloomberg.com
summary: The US government shutdown has impacted many federal institutions, leading to a budget deadlock in Washington. Amidst this, President Trump and Republicans have blamed Democrats for the shutdown and its negative effects. Despite the standoff, Trump announced that he had found a way to ensure US military personnel would be paid, instructing Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to release funds for troop paychecks on October 15. This move came as Republicans faced pressure to maintain pay for US forces during the shutdown.

title: Afghanistan Kills 58 Pakistani Soldiers in Border Clash
snippets: Afghanistan said Sunday it killed 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations, in response to what it called repeated violations of its territory and airspace.
Afghanistan’s Taliban government said nine Afghan soldiers were killed in the overnight attacks and Pakistan said it seized border posts.
titles: Afghanistan says it has killed 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations
Afghanistan’s Taliban say they killed 58 Pakistani soldiers in border clashes
summary: Afghanistan reported killing 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations, citing repeated territorial and airspace violations. The Taliban government acknowledged the loss of nine Afghan soldiers. Pakistan claimed to have seized border posts in the conflict.

title: Brewers Beat Cubs 3-1, Advance to NLCS for Third Time
snippets: The Milwaukee Brewers outlasted the Chicago Cubs in Game 5 of the NLDS on Saturday night at American Family Field. They will now face the Los Angeles Dodgers, a team they went 6-0 against in the regular season, in the NLCS beginning on Monday night.
For just the third time in franchise history, the Milwaukee Brewers are heading to the NLCS.
titles: Brewers edge Cubs to make first NLCS since 2018
Brewers knock off Cubs, advance to NLCS against Dodgers
summary: The Milwaukee Brewers defeated the Chicago Cubs 3-1 in Game 5 of the NL Division Series, marking their first playoff series win since 2018. This victory advances them to the NLCS for the third time in franchise history.

Quarterback Jacoby Brissett is expected to make his first start for the Cardinals on a field he knows well.

summary: Arizona Cardinals QB Kyler Murray will miss Sunday's game against the Colts because of a foot injury. Jacoby Brissett will replace him as the starting quarterback. This will be Brissett's first start for the Cardinals.

title: Ex-President Biden, 82, Starts Radiation for Advanced Prostate Cancer
snippets: Former US President Joe Biden has started radiation therapy to treat an aggressive form of prostate cancer that has spread to his bones.

Former president was diagnosed in May with ‘aggressive form’ of cancer and was already taking hormone medication Joe Biden is receiving radiation therapy for his prostate cancer that was diagnosed in May, a spokesperson for the former US president said on Saturday morning. “As part of a treatment pl
Biden Starts Radiation Treatment for Aggressive Prostate Cancer Bloomberg.com

Joe Biden receiving radiation therapy for prostate cancer
Biden Starts Radiation Treatment for Aggressive Prostate Cancer - Bloomberg.com
summary: Former US President Joe Biden, aged 82, has begun radiation therapy for an aggressive prostate cancer diagnosed in May, which has spread to his bones. He is also undergoing hormone treatment for the condition. This was confirmed by a spokesperson for Biden.

title: Elks Beat Blue Bombers 25-20, Keeping CFL Playoff Hopes Alive
snippets: Two stunning third-quarter touchdowns, followed by a stubborn fourth-quarter defence, carried the Elks to critical 25-20 victory over the Winnipeg Blue Bombers Saturday night, keeping Edmonton's slim CFL playoff hopes alive.

EDMONTON — Two stunning third-quarter touchdowns, followed by a stubborn fourth-quarter defence, carried the Elks to a critical 25-20 victory over the Winnipeg Blue Bombers Saturday night, keeping Edmonton’s slim CFL playoff hopes alive. Running back Justin Rankin’s 64-yard touchdown run on a third-down gamble, followed by Kordell Jackson’s 47-yard touchdown after recovering a teammate’s fumble, powered Edmonton to the win in front of 15,013 shivering fans on a wet 4 Celsius evening. “Not the prettiest at times but finding a way, all three phases finding a way against a good football team,”...
titles: Elks keep playoff hopes alive with 25-20 win
Elks keep playoff hopes alive with win over Blue Bombers
summary: The Edmonton Elks secured a critical 25-20 victory over the Winnipeg Blue Bombers, fueled by two third-quarter touchdowns and solid fourth-quarter defense. This win, highlighted by Justin Rankin's 64-yard touchdown and Kordell Jackson's 47-yard score, keeps Edmonton's CFL playoff hopes alive. The game, played in front of 15,013 fans in 4°C weather, was a testament to the team's resilience, as described by the Elks coach.

title: Thitikul Wins LPGA Shanghai After Dramatic Playoff Victory
snippets: Jeeno Thitikul came from four shots down with five holes to play to force a playoff with Minami Katsu, before producing another extraordinary shot on the fifth playoff hole to claim the LPGA Shanghai
Jeeno Thitikul secured a come-from-behind victory to win the LPGA Shanghai title.
titles: Jeeno Thitikul completes dramatic rally with five-hole playoff win at LPGA Shanghai
Dramatic Thitikul comeback secures LPGA Shanghai win
summary: Jeeno Thitikul overcame a four-shot deficit with five holes remaining to enter a playoff against Minami Katsu. Thitikul then won the LPGA Shanghai title on the fifth playoff hole with an extraordinary shot.

title: Madagascar Military Unit Claims Control Amid Protests, Escalating Crisis
snippets: An army unit claimed it had taken over leadership of the military command and was now in control of all the armed forces.

Soldiers from elite Capsat unit have announced they are taking over after weeks of youth-led protests Madagascar’s president said an “attempt to seize power illegally and by force” was under way, as an elite military unit that joined protesters on the streets on Saturday announced it was taking over
titles: Madagascar presidency says attempt to seize power under way
Madagascar’s president says illegal power grab by military is under way
summary: An elite military unit in Madagascar, known as Capsat, has declared that it has taken control of the country's armed forces following weeks of youth-led protests. The president of Madagascar acknowledged an ongoing illegal and forceful attempt to seize power. This development marks a significant escalation in the country's political crisis.

title: 204th Ranked Vacherot Wins Shanghai Masters Against Cousin Rinderknech
snippets: Le Monégasque, issu des qualifications et seulement 204e joueur mondial au début du tournoi, s’est imposé dimanche contre Arthur Rinderknech en trois sets (4-6, 6-3, 6-3).
Valentin Vacherot beat his own cousin Arthur Rinderknech in the Shanghai Masters final.
titles: Masters 1 000 de Shanghaï : Valentin Vacherot remporte la finale face à son cousin, le Français Arthur Rinderknech
Vacherot beats cousin Rinderknech to win Shanghai Masters
summary: Valentin Vacherot, ranked 204th globally, won the Shanghai Masters final against his cousin Arthur Rinderknech. Emerging from the qualifiers, he secured victory in three sets (4-6, 6-3, 6-3).

Forty-eight Israeli hostages are set to be released on Monday, with nearly 2,000 Palestinian detainees to follow. This comes as aid trucks enter Gaza, marking a significant step towards a potential lasting peace between Israel and Hamas.

title: Two Children Dead in Stafford, Woman Arrested on Suspicion of Murder

A 43-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder following the incident, which was reported around 7:30 am on Sunday. Police have urged the public not to speculate as the investigation continues. The woman remains in custody.

What is the new EU border system EES, and how will it work?
summary: Starting Sunday, UK passengers traveling to 29 European countries will experience changes due to the EU's new Entry/Exit System. This system requires most travelers to register their biometric information at the border, marking a significant shift in border security procedures for Britons visiting the EU.

summary: Ian Watkins, the former Lostprophets singer serving a 29-year sentence for 13 child sex offences since 2013, died in prison at age 48. Two men, aged 25 and 43, have been arrested on suspicion of his murder.

title: Apple Discontinues Clips Video Editing App
snippets: Apple’s Clips video editing app is no more. It debuted in 2017 as a way to stitch together videos with music, text, and filters with a clear focus on sharing to social media. Over the years Apple added AR features and more advanced video editing tools. But recently updates had slowed to a trickle. A
Apple appears to be winding down support of Clips, with the company removing Clips from the App Store and saying it will no longer be making any updates.
titles: Apple ends support for Clips video-editing app
Apple says goodbye to the Clips app
summary: Apple has discontinued its Clips video editing app, which launched in 2017 to allow users to create videos with music, text, and filters for social media. Despite adding AR features and advanced editing tools over time, updates had recently diminished. The company has removed Clips from the App Store and confirmed it will not provide further updates.

title: New Ice Forms Discovered; Foods High in Cysteine May Aid Intestinal Repair

Ice comes in many forms, even when made of nothing but water molecules. Scientists have now identified more than 20 unique solid structures, or “pha

The findings could provide a new approach to repairing tissue damage caused by radiation or chemotherapy treatment. A new study from MIT has found that consuming foods high in the amino acid cysteine may help restore and rejuvenate the small intestine. The researchers discovered that cysteine activa
titles: Scientists Discover a New Form of Ice That Shouldn’t Exist
MIT Scientists Discover Amino Acid That Rejuvenates the Gut
summary: Researchers at the European XFEL and DESY have discovered unusual forms of ice that remain solid at room temperature under extreme pressure, adding to the known 20+ solid structures of ice. Meanwhile, an MIT study found that foods high in cysteine could help repair tissue damage in the small intestine by activating a repair and rejuvenation process, offering potential benefits for radiation or chemotherapy treatment recovery.
